lines.text: I don't believe it. I don't believe it!
Well, there must be a practical side to having women along.
You mean like having your socks washed?
I've got myself railroaded into a stud poker game!
We're picking up a bomb of static. Must be due to the Van Allen Belt.
I came to see about supper.
Well, it's the altitude. It works up the appetite.
You're very forceful, aren't you?
Do I, er, need force?
I was talking about vibrations.
Oh. How are yours doing?
What do they say?
I'm not sure, but I like them.
And they like you. In time.
Katie, this isn't a hayride. We're here for a serious purpose!
What could be more serious than a hayride?

[to Marion Turner]
You know, without your glasses, you're a very pretty doctor.
Those chopstick jockeys couldn't come up with a planet buster, could they?
[last lines]

Last Of Man, listen. The craft you are attempting to communicate with no longer exists. Your sister craft no longer exists.The signal you are following is a warning. Had you been able to decipher its meaning, you would not have attempted to trespass on our world.
Your world. Who are you?

We are the collective minds of this world your craft now orbits. Be it enough for you to know that during the span of our evolution, our civilization has witnessed the birth & death of worlds & suns untold. But enough. Your time is short. You may not enter our world. We have witnessed the self-destructive powers of the green planet you call Earth. We have no malice toward you. You have destroyed your place in the universe. Last Of Man, listen. Of this we will tell you. Your journey will continue. Something very strange and very great awaits you beyond the rim of the universe. And now, Last Of Man, your journey will begin.
[explosion]

[maneuvering to avoid meteors]
Doc, how much reserve fuel can I use?
We've got the whole return booster.
We're not going home, so shoot the works, Skipper.
